plugin_desc: It is used to collect metrics on Oracle's uptime, operation counts, transaction commits/rollbacks, and various wait times in real-time via the exporter method, assisting users in health checks and performance tuning.
name: Oracle

metrics.name: oracledb_up_gauge
metrics.description: The current Oracle database is running in the current state, 0 is normal, and 1 is abnormal.

metrics.name: oracledb_uptime_seconds_gauge
metrics.description: The duration for which the Oracle database has been running.

metrics.name: oracledb_activity_execute_rate
metrics.description: Monitors the rate of SQL executions over a period (e.g., 5m) to reflect load changes.

metrics.name: oracledb_activity_parse_rate
metrics.description: Monitors the rate of SQL parses in a period (e.g., 5m) to help identify frequent parsing issues.

metrics.name: oracledb_activity_user_commits_rate
metrics.description: Monitors the rate of user transaction commits over a period (e.g., 5m) to reflect transactional activity.

metrics.name: oracledb_activity_user_rollbacks_rate
metrics.description: Monitors the rate of user transaction rollbacks over a period (e.g., 5m) to identify unusual transactions.

metrics.name: oracledb_wait_time_application_gauge
metrics.description: The waiting time for communication between the database client application and the database.

metrics.name: oracledb_wait_time_commit_gauge
metrics.description: The time waiting for transaction commit completion.

metrics.name: oracledb_wait_time_concurrency_gauge
metrics.description: The waiting time caused by database resource contention, such as waiting for locks.

metrics.name: oracledb_wait_time_configuration_gauge
metrics.description: The time waiting for system resource configuration, such as waiting for parameter changes to take effect.

metrics.name: oracledb_wait_time_network_gauge
metrics.description: The time waiting for network transmission, such as waiting for data to be sent from the client to the server.

metrics.name: oracledb_wait_time_other_gauge
metrics.description: The waiting time that cannot be classified into other waiting times.

metrics.name: oracledb_wait_time_system_io_gauge
metrics.description: The time waiting for the system to perform I/O operations, such as waiting for data to be read from the disk.

metrics.name: oracledb_wait_time_user_io_gauge
metrics.description: The time waiting for the user I/O operation to complete.

metrics.name: oracledb_resource_utilization_rate
metrics.description: The utilization rate of a resource in the current Oracle DB instance, which reflects the percentage of resources such as sessions, processes, memory, and so on that resource limits are used. If the value is negative（-）, the resource is not restricted, that is, the resource can be used indefinitely. In this case, it doesn't make much sense to monitor metrics for that dimension.

metrics.name: oracledb_process_count_gauge
metrics.description: The number of currently active database processes.

metrics.name: oracledb_sessions_value_gauge

dimensions.name: status
dimensions.description: Session status, such as ACTION, INACTIVE, BLOCKED, KILLED, etc.

dimensions.name: type
dimensions.description: Session type, such as Backend, CDB, PDB, SYS, USER, etc.

metrics.description: The current number of open sessions in the database. Dimension meaning: Status: Session status, such as ACTION, INACTIVE, BLOCKED, KILLED, etc. Type: Session type, such as Backend, CDB, PDB, SYS, USER, etc.

metrics.name: oracledb_sga_total_gauge
metrics.description: SGA is a shared memory area allocated in memory by an Oracle database instance to store global data and information to support the operation and access of the database instance. This metric is used to represent the total memory size of SGA and is used to measure the overall resource allocation scale of SGA.

metrics.name: oracledb_sga_free_gauge
metrics.description: Represents the amount of memory currently available for the Oracle Database SGA, reflecting the amount of unused idle resources in the SGA.

metrics.name: oracledb_sga_used_percent_gauge
metrics.description: Represents the memory usage of the Oracle Database SGA and is used to evaluate the efficiency of the SGA's resources.

metrics.name: oracledb_pga_total_gauge
metrics.description: A PGA is an independently allocated area of memory for each user process or server process in an Oracle database instance that stores data and information for sessions or operations. This metric is used to represent the total memory size of the PGA and reflect the overall resource allocation scale of the PGA.

metrics.name: oracledb_pga_used_gauge
metrics.description: Represents the amount of memory currently used by the Oracle Database PGA, reflecting the actual consumption of PGA resources.

metrics.name: oracledb_pga_used_percent_gauge
metrics.description: Represents the memory usage of the Oracle Database PGA, which is a measure of how efficiently the PGA resources are being utilized.

metrics.name: oracledb_tablespace_bytes_gauge

dimensions.name: type
dimensions.description: Tablespace Type, such as SYSTEM, UNDO, TEMP, etc.

metrics.description: The total size of the used disk space in the specified tablespace.

metrics.name: oracledb_tablespace_max_bytes_gauge

dimensions.name: type
dimensions.description: Tablespace Type, such as SYSTEM, UNDO, TEMP, etc.

metrics.description: The maximum disk space limit of the specified tablespace.

metrics.name: oracledb_tablespace_free_gauge

dimensions.name: type
dimensions.description: Tablespace Type, such as SYSTEM, UNDO, TEMP, etc.

metrics.description: The size of the remaining disk space in the specified tablespace.

metrics.name: oracledb_tablespace_used_percent_gauge

dimensions.name: type
dimensions.description: Tablespace Type, such as SYSTEM, UNDO, TEMP, etc.

metrics.description: The percentage of the used capacity of the specified tablespace.

metrics.name: oracledb_rac_node_gauge
metrics.description: The current number of Oracle database cluster nodes.

metrics.name: process_cpu_seconds_total_counter
metrics.display_name: OracleDb Monitoring Probe Process CPU Time
metrics.description: The total amount of CPU time used by the Oracle Database Monitoring Probe process.

metrics.name: process_max_fds_gauge
metrics.display_name: OracleDb Monitoring Probe Process Max File Descriptors
metrics.description: The maximum number of file descriptors that can be opened by the Oracle Database monitoring probe process.

metrics.name: process_open_fds_gauge
metrics.display_name: OracleDb Monitoring Probe Process Open File Descriptors
metrics.description: The number of file descriptors that are currently open by the Oracle Database monitoring probe process.

metrics.name: process_resident_memory_bytes_gauge
metrics.display_name: OracleDb Monitoring Probe Process Resident Memory
metrics.description: The size of the current resident memory of the Oracle Database monitoring probe process.

metrics.name: process_virtual_memory_bytes_gauge
metrics.display_name: OracleDb Monitoring Probe Process Virtual Memory
metrics.description: The current virtual memory size of the Oracle Database Monitoring Probe process.

metrics.name: oracledb_exporter_last_scrape_duration_seconds_gauge
metrics.description: The time spent on the most recent collection of indicators from the Oracle database.

metrics.name: oracledb_exporter_last_scrape_error_gauge
metrics.description: Whether an error occurred when the OracleDB monitoring probe collected indicators in the most recent time.

metrics.name: oracledb_exporter_scrapes_total_counter
metrics.description: The total number of times of collecting indicators since the OracleDB monitoring probe was started, and if the process is restarted, it will be recalculated.
